title: Losing control of my character / Massive lagspikes AT STABLE FPS AND PING
body:
So, I am playing on 60fps and 40 ms, which is totally fine. But then randomly, about once per minute, I lose control of my character entirely for a second or two. It feels in general as though I was playing with 200+ ms, which I really dont think cause I dont have any massive lag issues in other games and my internet is good enough to support the game without a doubt. I am also using a cable (not wi-fi) so I doubt it is packet loss and also I am the only person using this internet access currently.

It is nearly unplayable when I just take a timeout in the middle of a teamfight for 1-2 seconds, sometimes even up to 5.

I have looked carefully at the ping ingame and it has never gone up or down by more than 3 the entire game.

Also, with the "press selected spell upon casting another one" on AND off, if I (riven) press eqqw quickly and tell riven to move back just as the e finishes casting it still goes through the entire combo AND even does the W at the end, despite me spamclicking backwards, whereas it should stop after the first q.

I've seen a thread on this with 6.1 and 6.2 but haven't seen any since.

Help? :3

edit: This occured in the first game after patching today, but since I wasnt online for a couple weeks the patch may be a month old

replies.body: wow and now i have the same issue in other games... dafuq

Thanks for the update and information!  It does seem like your network is having problems maintaining comms with the game server, and there's a few ways to fix it!  Go through each step of the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to rule out possibilities as well as tune up your PC.  I hope it helps!

It sounds like you're having some sort of network issue or packet loss more specifically, and it's causing you to have these delays.  Run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) for these matches for an analysis of what's happening.  Let me know what you find!

I did the log reader thing and it seems like we are not totally wrong on the packet loss.

"Your average ping was 39 milliseconds, which means your ping was good overall.

Your percentage of packet loss for this game was 1.66%.

Overall, this means you had a high amount of packets lost during the game. This can be caused by various network issues, so please see below for a few common steps that can help reduce packet loss."

looking at the graph for packet loss, which is alot of bars at 6-8% and gaps inbetween, I'm wondering I can have such a large packet loss in LAN?

Looking at the list of suggestions, it could have been something with the ISP, so let's hope on that and it fixing soonTM.
